excerpt: Elegant, domed, white marble museum, opened in 1921, housing displays on the history of Kolkata.
detail_description: Victoria Memorial is an exquisite white marble museum in Kolkata, built in 1921 as a tribute to Queen Victoria. The grand architecture and well-maintained gardens make it a popular spot for locals and tourists alike. Inside, the museum showcases the history of Kolkata and the British Empire in India. It also boasts a remarkable collection of over 5,000 paintings by renowned artists from the Bengal School of Art.
name: Victoria Memorial
address: Victoria Memorial Hall, 1, Queens Way, Maidan, Kolkata, West Bengal 700071, India

detail_description: Belur Math, located downstream from Dakshineswar Kali Temple, spans 40 acres and serves as the central hub for the Ramakrishna Math and Mission. Established by Swami Vivekananda, a prominent disciple of Ramakrishna Paramahamsa, this serene site features a main shrine honoring Sri Ramakrishna with an architectural blend of Hindu, Buddhist, Christian, and Islamic influences.
name: Belur Math
address: Howrah, West Bengal 711202, India

excerpt: Bustling cantilever road bridge opened since 1943 and spanning the Hooghly River.
detail_description: The Howrah Bridge, also known as Rabindra Setu, is a bustling cantilever road bridge that spans the Hooghly River, connecting Kolkata and Howrah in Bengal. Built by the British and opened in 1943, it is one of the busiest bridges in India. Despite its age, it is referred to as the 'New Howrah Bridge' and stands as an enduring symbol of Kolkata.
name: Howrah Bridge
address: Kolkata, West Bengal 700001, India

excerpt: 269-acre botanic garden founded in 1786 with a serpentine lake, rare tree breeds & indigenous flora.
detail_description: Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Indian Botanic Garden, established in 1786, spans 269 acres and is home to over 12,000 plant species. The garden played a significant role in cultivating tea bushes smuggled from China by the British. It features a cactus house, palm collection, river overlook, and a boating lake with Giant Water Lily pads.
name: Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Indian Botanic Garden
address: Shibpur, Howrah, West Bengal 711103, India

excerpt: 9 ornate spires top this riverside red and cream 1800s temple, with shrines to Krishna and Vishnu.
detail_description: Dakshineswar Kali Temple is a 1800s temple located on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River in Kolkata. It was built by Rani Rashmoni and features nine ornate spires in classic Nava-Ratna style. The temple is dedicated to Bhavatarini, a manifestation of goddess Kali, and also houses shrines to Krishna and Vishnu.
name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
address: Dakshineswar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700076, India

excerpt: Indian heritage museum with sections on archaeology, art, anthropology and geology, founded in 1814.
detail_description: The Indian Museum, founded in 1814, is a significant heritage site in India. It's the country's largest and oldest museum, featuring a diverse range of exhibits across its 35 galleries. Visitors can explore artifacts from various disciplines including archaeology, art, anthropology, geology, zoology and economic botany.
name: Indian Museum
address: 27, Jawaharlal Nehru Rd, Fire Brigade Head Quarter, New Market Area, Dharmatala, Taltala, Kolkata, West Bengal 700016, India

excerpt: Monumental marble Hindu temple built between 1970 & 1996, with Krishna, Radha, Shiva & Durga idols.
detail_description: Birla Mandir, located in Kolkata, India, is a grand marble Hindu temple complex built between 1970 and 1996. Sponsored by the Birla family, it consists of three intricately carved temples dedicated to Lord Krishna and Goddess Radha in the main shrine, while the other two domes honor Lord Shiva and Goddess Durga. The entire structure is made of marble with towering pagoda-like monoliths at the entrance.
name: Birla Mandir
address: 29, Ashutosh Chowdary Ave, Ballygunge, Kolkata, West Bengal 700019, India

excerpt: Prominent city thoroughfare featuring historic sites, boutiques, cafes & a vibrant nightlife.
detail_description: Park Street, also known as Mother Teresa Sarani, is a prominent thoroughfare in Kolkata, West Bengal. It is renowned for its historic sites, upscale boutiques, charming cafes, and vibrant nightlife. The street offers a wide array of internationally-recognized fast-food outlets, English-style pubs, hip nightclubs, and restaurants serving diverse cuisines. Additionally, it boasts western-style supermarkets and enticing bookshops.
name: Park St
address: Kolkata, West Bengal, India

detail_description: Vidyasagar Setu, also known as the Second Hooghly Bridge, is a magnificent cable-stayed bridge that spans the Hooghly River, linking Kolkata and Howrah. Named after the renowned Bengali reformer Ishwar Chandra Vidyasagar, it holds cultural and historical significance. Opened in 1992, it is the longest bridge of its kind in India and Asia.
name: Vidyasagar Setu
address: National Highway, 12, Kolkata, West Bengal 700022, India

excerpt: Major, 66,000-capacity cricket ground hosting Indian Premier League and international matches.
detail_description: Eden Gardens is a renowned 66,000-capacity cricket ground in Kolkata, India. It hosts various matches including Indian Premier League and international games. The city of Kolkata offers a blend of historical and modern attractions such as Victoria Memorial, Indian Museum, Kalighat Temple, Marble Palace, Nicco Park and Dakshineswar Kali Temple. Despite its initial chaos, Kolkata promises an unforgettable experience for adventurous travelers.
name: Eden Gardens
address: Maidan, B.B.D. Bagh, Kolkata, West Bengal 700021, India

excerpt: Stately, 19th-century private residence with unique art & landscaped grounds, plus guided tours.
detail_description: The Marble Palace, situated at 46 Muktaram Babu Street in Kolkata, is a grand 19th-century mansion built in neoclassical style. It boasts an impressive collection of art and artifacts, including paintings by renowned artists such as Rubens and Sir Joshua Reynolds. The opulent mansion features a variety of Victorian furniture, chandeliers, clocks, mirrors, and more.
name: Marble Palace
address: Raja Katra, Machuabazar, Kolkata, West Bengal 700007, India

excerpt: Kolkata (formerly Calcutta) is the capital of India's West Bengal state. Founded as an East India Company trading post, it was India's capital under the British Raj from 1773–1911. Today it’s known for its grand colonial architecture, art galleries and cultural festivals. It’s also home to Mother House, headquarters of the Missionaries of Charity, founded by Mother Teresa, whose tomb is on site.
detail_description: Kolkata, formerly known as Calcutta, is the capital of India's West Bengal state and was once the capital of British India. The city boasts grand colonial architecture, vibrant art galleries, and a rich cultural heritage. It is also home to Mother House, the headquarters of the Missionaries of Charity founded by Mother Teresa. Kolkata's alleyways are now filled with cafes offering diverse menus and unique decor.
name: Kolkata
address: West Bengal, India

excerpt: Maidan is a massive green space with trails, riverside picnic spots, and sporting venues that include the iconic Eden Gardens cricket ground, golf courses, and a polo club. Set in stately landscaped gardens, Victoria Memorial is a white-domed museum displaying Indian and Western art. St. Paul’s Cathedral is a neo-Gothic landmark from 1847. Family attractions include Nehru Children’s Museum and M.P. Birla Planetarium.
detail_description: Maidan is a sprawling green space in the heart of Kolkata, offering trails, picnic spots by the riverside, and various sporting venues including the famous Eden Gardens cricket ground. The area also features Victoria Memorial, a museum showcasing Indian and Western art, as well as St. Paul’s Cathedral. Families can enjoy attractions like Nehru Children’s Museum and M.P. Birla Planetarium nearby.
name: Maidan
address: New Market Area, Kolkata, West Bengal, India

detail_description: Avani Riverside Mall is a vibrant and energetic shopping destination located across the 2nd Hooghly Bridge, catering to residents on both sides of the river. The mall offers a wide variety of branded shops, restaurants, and an attractive play area. Its riverside view adds a romantic touch to the overall experience. With grocery stores like Big Bazaar, gift shops like Archies, and trendy clothing at Pantaloons, there's something for everyone.
name: Avani Riverside Mall
address: 32, Jagat Banerjee Ghat Rd, Choura Bustee, Shibpur, Howrah, West Bengal 711102, India

excerpt: Interactive garden with a maze & children's play equipment at a landmark science & tech museum.
detail_description: Science City in Kolkata is a landmark science and tech museum that offers an educational and fun experience for visitors of all ages. The center features interactive exhibits and cutting-edge technology to bring science to life, including 3D shows, motion simulation time machine, digital panorama, and robotic dinosaurs. Visitors can explore a maritime center, butterfly nursery, aquarium, outdoor maze, and toy train.
name: Science City
address: JBS Haldane Ave, Mirania Gardens, East Topsia, Topsia, Kolkata, West Bengal 700046, India

detail_description: College Street, also known as "Boi Para" or Book Town, is a must-visit destination in Kolkata for book lovers. Spanning 1.5 km and located between Ganesh Chandra Avenue Crossing and Mahatma Gandhi Road, this street is lined with an array of bookstores, including major players in the Bengali publication industry such as Ananda Publishers, Deys Publishers, and Abhijan Publishers.
name: College St
address: College Square, Kolkata, West Bengal, India

excerpt: This sprawling, 18th-century Christian graveyard features large, picturesque tombstones.
detail_description: South Park Street Cemetery, an 18th-century Christian graveyard in Kolkata, is known for its large and picturesque tombstones. It is home to the final resting places of notable figures such as Walter Landor Dickens, Captain Edward Cooke, and Maj General Charles Stuart. The cemetery also features Grave 363, famous for its epitaph that reads 'A virtuous mother.'
name: South Park Street Cemetery
address: 52, मदर टेरेसा सरनी, Opposite The Assembly of God Church School, Park Street, Mullick Bazar, Park Street area, Kolkata, West Bengal 700017, India

excerpt: British East India Company headquarters designed in 1777, now West Bengal state government offices.
detail_description: Writers' Building, originally constructed in 1777 as the headquarters of the British East India Company, now serves as the offices for the West Bengal state government. This Greco-Roman landmark has a scandalous history, including its construction and subsequent usage by Governor-General Marquess Wellesley. Situated at the northern end of Dalhousie Square, it was initially used to house junior writers of the East India Company, hence its name.
name: Writers' Building
address: H8FX+GGJ, Binoy Badal Dinesh Bag N Rd, Lal Dighi, B.B.D. Bagh, Kolkata, West Bengal 700001, India

excerpt: Scenic shoreline park with balustrades overlooking the water, landscaped gardens & amusement rides.
detail_description: Millennium Park in Kolkata is a picturesque waterfront park that stretches along the Hooghly River, offering stunning views of the river and the iconic Howrah Bridge. The park's landscaped gardens, manicured lawns, and lovely sculptures create a romantic setting for couples to enjoy some quality time together. Situated beside the Ganges, it provides a peaceful and private ambiance with cool breezes perfect for romance.
name: Millennium Park
address: 12, Strand Rd, Bara Bazar, B.B.D. Bagh, Kolkata, West Bengal 700001, India

detail_description: The Rail Museum, Howrah, is a top tourist spot in the area and houses a collection of historic railway artifacts including India's first electric locomotive and antique steam engines. Visitors can explore models, replicas, and exhibits showcasing the evolution of electrification. The museum features a miniature replica of Howrah railway station and offers a toy train ride for an immersive experience. While the premises are well-maintained, some visitors have expressed concerns about security personnel not being vigilant enough with the exhibits.
name: Rail Museum, Howrah, Kolkata
address: H8HQ+5XX, Rail Museum Toy Train Line, Howrah Railway Station, Howrah, West Bengal 711101, India
